title: The Deloitte Connection
subtitle: How Florida Awarded $135M to a Contractor It Was Suing

publicStatements.quote: There's going to be a whole investigation that's going to need to be done about how the state of Florida could have paid $77 million for this thing.
publicStatements.speaker: Ron DeSantis

publicStatements.quote: The system is a clunker... designed to create pointless roadblocks so people would say 'the hell with it.'
publicStatements.speaker: Ron DeSantis

publicStatements.quote: It'd be my preference that [Deloitte] not get anything.
publicStatements.speaker: Ron DeSantis

whatActuallyHappened.action: Mary Mayhew leaves for Hospital Association

theContradiction.summary: Deloitte got fined $8M and rewarded with $135M simultaneously.

problems: Job seekers waited 'weeks and months' for benefits
connectSystem.covidImpact: March 2020 - system crashed when unemployment tripled to 12.9%

newContract.note: Perfect score while being actively sued

keyPlayers.name: Jennifer Ungru
keyPlayers.role: AHCA Chief of Staff / Deloitte Lobbyist
background: Deputy Chief of Staff to Governor Rick Scott
Lead recount manager for DeSantis 2018 victory
keyPlayers.concern: Lobbied for Deloitte contract she knew intimately from AHCA

keyPlayers.name: Tom McCullion

timeline.action: Wrote 'system is unstable' after Deloitte delivered
Advised on new Deloitte Medicaid contract

keyPlayers.pattern: Official who oversaw first failure advised on second contract

desantisExcuse.quote: They dropped their price so dramatically, that it's not clear to me that at that point they could have been denied it on neutral grounds.
problems: AHCA gave Deloitte 10/10 on past performance while being sued
His inaugural committee member and recount manager lobby for Deloitte
He uses emergency powers for $6B+ in other no-bid contracts
Mary Mayhew left for industry she regulated immediately after

unansweredQuestions: Why was Tom McCullion hired at AHCA to advise on Deloitte contract after overseeing their failed CONNECT project?
Who made the decision to give Deloitte a '10' on past performance when they were actively being sued?
What role did Deloitte's lobbyists (Ungru, Moya) play in winning the $135M contract?
Why didn't DeSantis use emergency powers to stop the Deloitte contract when he uses them for billions in other contracts?
Are there more Deloitte contracts hidden in the $6B of emergency contracts with missing documentation?
